intro: Goudaea ospinae, commonly known as the Ospina's goudaea, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant has elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves that are dark green in color and often have a waxy texture. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is adapted to the specific microclimates of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
